availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, attorney. Lexington native. Son of Thomas H. Waters and Caroline C. Waters. Graduated from Transylvania University in Lexington in 1852. Graduated from Georgetown College in Georgetown, District of Columbia, in 1855. Graduated from the Transylvania University Law Department in 1856. Admitted to practice law in 1856. Attorney in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl: Robert Peter, M.D., History of Fayette County, Kentucky, With an Outline Sketch of the Blue Grass Region (Chicago: O.L. Baskin & Co., Historical Publishers, 1882), 745. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District No. 2, p. 206B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, 3rd Ward, Lexington, p. 149. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, 3rd Ward, Lexington, p. 38.
